docs.snippet: The windows of two buildings on Canal Street are covered in sticky-note re-creations of cartoon characters, memes and logos, the result of a friendly back and forth between firms....
docs.lead_paragraph: The windows of two buildings on Canal Street are covered in sticky-note re-creations of cartoon characters, memes and logos, the result of a friendly back and forth between firms.
docs.abstract: Employees of competing advertising firms, all located in buildings facing Canal Street in Manhattan's Chinatown, are engaged in friendly back-and-forth in which they have created art works and messages out of post-it notes, on windows facing street; exchange has caught attention of passers-by and social media.

headline.main: Manhattan Office Workers Start a Post-it War, and Stick With It
